snippet: Many Americans with health insurance bought under the Affordable Care Act could face substantial price increases next year — in some cases as much as 20 percent.
abstract: Obama administration unveils data showing that many Americans with health insurance bought under Affordable Care Act could face substantial prices increases in 2015 unless they switch plans; notes that health plan prices vary greatly from state to state and urges consumers to shop around for best deal; Republicans argue that data offers evidence that Affordable Care Act is not working.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR, REED ABELSON and AGUSTIN ARMENDARIZ

lead_paragraph: Many Americans with health insurance bought under the Affordable Care Act could face substantial price increases next year — in some cases as much as 20 percent.

headline.main: Cost of Coverage Under Affordable Care Act to Increase in 2015
headline.print_headline: Cost of Coverage Under Care Act Set to Increase

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

keywords.value: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
